result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyson L. Strickland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, with any balance to be paid by working out a payment plan with agent as a condition of community supervision.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
No DNA sample or surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety to include no possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances, illegal drugs, intoxicating substances or any other controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers or places known where drugs can be obtained illegally.
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyson L. Strickland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyson L. Strickland in court, in custody with attorney Brad Hansen. Prosecuting Atty Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for State of Wisconsin.
10:59 am
Court spks on charges and penalties
Court advises:  May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
 No firearms.  
Voting rights form
Court spks on letters in support
ADA takes no issue with PSI
Atty Hansen takes no issue with PSI
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Hansen spks on sentencing
Defendant addresses Court
Court imposes: 3 yrs 6 months; 1 yr 6 months initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision, concurrent to 14CF174.  Credit for 66 days.  Defendant is eligible for CIP & SAP.
Costs and service fees; up to 25% may be deducted from inmate monies with any balance to be paid by working out a payment plan with agent.
No DNA surcharge or sample.
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety to include no possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances, illegal drugs, inxtoxicating substances or any other controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No entrance into in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers or places known where drugs can be obtained illegally.
Written Expl of Det Sent form
Appeal rights.
11:28 am
Per Local Court rule - plea agreement, higher number case travels to lower case number Judge

plea quest/WOR

Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Defendant Tyson L. Strickland. Prosecuting Atty Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tyson L. Strickland appeared by video means, in custody.
3:24 pm
Def waives prelim
Prelim quest/WOR
Court finds def freely waives prelim
Atty Hansen spks - def has STC in Br I on Tuesday next week in a different case

Court spks - no objection to having case heard in Br 1
Atty Hansen spks on bail - reduce by $5,000
ADA spks on bail - objects
Court questions def's father on bail 
Court sets $10,000 cash bail - same conditions
